node.title: Thomas Jefferson Statue Will be Removed From City Hall in New York, Then Relocated
node.alt: A statue of Thomas Jefferson in New York's City Hall will be removed and relocated to the New York Historical Society. Above, Rudulph Evans' statue of Thomas Jefferson with excerpts of the Declaration of Independence seen behind in the Jefferson Memorial in Washington, D.C.
node.description: The statue will be moved to the New York Historical Society's lobby for six months, then to the library reading room.
node.content:
["A statue of Thomas Jefferson from 1833 will be moved from City Hall in New York to the New York Historical Society's lobby.", "The relocation is a long-term loan, according to the Associated Press. The decision was made after some of the City Council's Black, Latino and Asian members objected to the statue's presence due to Jefferson owning hundreds of slaves, the Gothamist reported.", "In a statement released by the Black, Latino and Asian caucus, they said Jefferson is an individual \"no longer worthy of exaltation in an era where the ancestors of those they subjugated now hold the very seats of power derived from the systems of government they established.\"", "On Monday, the Public Design Commission voted unanimously to remove the statue from the City Council chambers at City Hall. The statue will be on display in the historical society's lobby with information about Jefferson's legacy for six months, then moved to the society's library reading room.", "The historical society's president and chief executive Louise Mirrer said the statue would be shown starting in April and would correspond with an exhibition that looks at the \"principal contradiction of our founding ideals,\" The New York Times reported.", "The commission was prepared to vote on the move last month, but critics said it would it would set a bad example to send a city-owned piece of art to a private museum. The New York Times also reported that the delay was due to concerns the statue would not be freely accessible if placed at the historical society, and that members of the public opposed the proposal in a virtual public hearing. However, the loan was approved with little discussion.", "For more reporting from the Associated Press, see below. ", "", "
A statue of Thomas Jefferson in New York's City Hall will be removed and relocated to the New York Historical Society. Above, Rudulph Evans' statue of Thomas Jefferson with excerpts of the Declaration of Independence seen behind in the Jefferson Memorial in Washington, D.C.
", "The statue by artist Pierre-Jean David d'Angers is a plaster model of the bronze Jefferson statue in the Capitol rotunda of the U.S. Congress.", "Museum officials said in a statement they would offer context about Jefferson's \"complicated legacy\" including \"his contributions as a founder and draftsman of the Declaration of Independence and the contradiction between his vision of human equality and his ownership of enslaved people.\" It will be accessible to the public without an admission charge in both locations, they said.", "The statue was donated to the city in 1834 by Uriah Phillips Levy, who was the first Jewish commodore of the United States Navy and who commissioned the statue to honor Jefferson's commitment to religious freedom.", "The statue has stood in the room where the City Council meets."]
